entry.title: Crypto Labor Market Trends Don’t Echo Traditional Tech, Hiring Experts Say
entry.summary: From “quiet layoffs” to “wildcat firms,” the working class of Web3 is undergoing a major shift.

entry.title: Blur to Airdrop $300M In Extra Tokens to 'Loyal' NFT Traders
entry.summary: The upstart NFT marketplace, flying high after overtaking OpenSea, is pushing an aggressive incentives program to draw users.

entry.title: Bulgarian Investigators Claim 'Cryptoqueen' Was Murdered in 2018
entry.summary: The hunt for Ruja Ignatova may have already ended at the bottom of the Ionian Sea.

entry.title: Ubisoft Continues Web3 Push With Rabbids NFTs in The Sandbox
entry.summary: The Assassin’s Creed publisher is still building in Web3, adding Rabbids NFT avatars to its growing pile of crypto industry moves.

entry.title: Nearly $370 Billion in Bitcoin Has Gone 'Dormant'—Here’s Why
entry.summary: Investors are keeping their coins still, with the amount of Bitcoin not budging nearing a new all-time high.

entry.title: Solana Spaces Closing Stores in NYC and Miami
entry.summary: The team behind Solana Spaces shifts away from brick-and-mortar gateways to onboard people into Web3.

entry.title: Coinbase Reports Revenue Increase in Q4 Despite FTX Collapse
entry.summary: The leading crypto exchange in the U.S. reported sales that came in above analyst expectations.

entry.title: Crypto-Friendly Bank Silvergate Is Most Shorted Stock
entry.summary: Amid a regulatory crackdown on crypto, more traders are betting Silvergate’s stock will go down.

entry.title: Friendsies 'Rug Pull' NFT Holders—Could the Community Take Over?
entry.summary: Holders are calling Friendsies a “rug pull” after failing to deliver on promises—but some hope to pick up where FriendsWithYou left off.

entry.title: Fake Bing ChatGPT Tokens Pop Up Amid AI Hype
entry.summary: As AI excitement grows, a stream of malicious cryptocurrencies leveraging brand names has appeared on the market.

entry.title: Multicoin, Sequoia Lead $6M Round in Solana-based Crypto Wallet TipLink
entry.summary: The premise is simple: The transaction is the wallet, meaning anyone can use it. Now, TipLink is expanding the idea with fresh funding.

entry.title: DraftKings Tees Up PGA Tour NFT Fantasy Golf Game
entry.summary: Reignmakers PGA Tour will launch in March, letting users battle for millions of dollars in prize money via Polygon NFT player cards.

entry.title: MATIC Drops 6% as Polygon Labs Slashes Headcount by 20%
entry.summary: As part of a larger consolidation first announced on January 11, Polygon Labs today announced it would be laying off 100 employees.

entry.title: Polygon’s Crypto Unicorns Game Adds Former Axie Infinity Esports Head
entry.summary: Andrew Campbell has joined Crypto Unicorns developer Laguna Games to help expand its "multiverse" as Product and Market Growth Lead.

entry.title: What Are Stablecoins and How Do You Use Them?
entry.summary: Stablecoins are cryptocurrencies that claim to be backed by fiat currencies. Unlike cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, their prices remain steady.

entry.title: HIVE Increases Bitcoin Production in First Full Quarter Without Ethereum Mining
entry.summary: HIVE Blockchain increased its Bitcoin mining production amid an ongoing crypto winter, boasting an increase of 13% year-over-year.

entry.title: Stacks Token Soars 130% on the Week Amid Bitcoin NFT Hype
entry.summary: With Bitcoin-based NFTs attracting the market’s attention, Stacks appears to be enjoying the spotlight with a steady rise in activity.

entry.title: Coder Brings Ordinals to Litecoin as Bitcoin Inscriptions Surpass 154K
entry.summary: The race to bring NFTs to more proof-of-work blockchains is on, as Ordinals inscriptions were introduced to Litecoin.

entry.title: Blur Overtakes OpenSea as Ethereum NFT Trading Skyrockets
entry.summary: Over $500 million worth of Ethereum NFT trades took place over the past week as Blur’s rewards model catapults it over OpenSea.

entry.title: Proof Collective Cancels Conference, Ruffling Moonbirds NFT Holders
entry.summary: Some Moonbirds holders aren’t accepting Proof CEO Kevin Rose’s apologies as they unstake their NFTs following news of the canceled event.

entry.title: If You Bought Bitcoin After 2015, You've Likely Lost Money: BIS
entry.summary: A report from the Bank for International Settlements claims "sophisticated" Bitcoin investors have made money but most retail buyers have lost out.

entry.title: FTX Japan Users Can Resume Withdrawing Funds Tomorrow
entry.summary: Customers of FTX Japan will be able to withdraw cryptocurrencies and fiat currency deposited with the company.

entry.title: Number of Bitcoin Whales Drops to Lowest Level Since 2019
entry.summary: Bitcoin wallets holding over 1,000 BTC peaked in February 2021. Now, though, whale pods are dwindling fast.

entry.title: Crypto's Speculative Nature Makes It 'Really Dangerous': Tim Berners-Lee
entry.summary: The inventor of the World Wide Internet Tim Berners-Lee has called crypto "dangerous" due to its highly speculative nature.

entry.title: Hong Kong Mulls Reopening Crypto Trading for Retail Investors
entry.summary: A new consultation paper from Hong Kong's financial regulator outlined several new criteria for letting retail investors back into crypto.

entry.title: What Backs Bitcoin?
entry.summary: Bitcoin doesn't need to be backed by anything tangible to be valuable; like fiat currencies, much of its value derives from consumer confidence.

entry.title: What Is Stepn? The ‘Move-to-Earn’ NFT App That Pays You Crypto to Exercise
entry.summary: Stepn lets users earn crypto for exercising—giving them real returns for walking, jogging or running. But gameplay is complicated.

entry.title: Galois Capital to Shutter Flagship Crypto Fund Citing 'FTX Disaster'
entry.summary: There’s another high-profile victim of the FTX meltdown as crypto hedge fund Galois Capital moved to close its business.

entry.title: Solana Soars Double-Digits as Helium Network Announces Merge Date
entry.summary: The upcoming Helium migration and substantial NFT sales volume appear to be fueling a double-digit recovery for Solana.

entry.title: Founder of WallStreetBets on Reddit Sues Reddit
entry.summary: Jaime Rogozinski, who founded the now-iconic subreddit for financial degens, wants a court to reinstate him.

entry.title: New YouTube CEO Is Bullish on Web3 Tech Like NFTs and the Metaverse
entry.summary: Neal Mohan has said that NFTs could enable “creators to build deeper relationships with their fans.”

entry.title: San Francisco Fed Hiring for Digital Currency Development
entry.summary: Like its New York-based counterpart, the office is looking for a CBDC developer.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: SEC Crypto Crackdown Met with Colossal Criticism
entry.summary: And an angry artist accused Bored Ape Yacht Club creators Yuga Labs of plagiarizing their iconic skull logo.

entry.title: Yuga Labs to Replace Logo That Apes a Kids Drawing Guide
entry.summary: Despite a market cap of over $115 million, Yuga Labs appears to have taken an unlicensed design for its Bored Ape Kennel Club logo.

entry.title: 'NFT Art Is Fairly Silly’ Says Casa CTO Jameson Lopp on Bitcoin Ordinals Rise
entry.summary: The rise of Bitcoin NFTs has sparked new outrage within the maximalist community. But for Casa’s CTO it’s time to grow up and move on.

entry.title: DAI Finds Its Spark With Spark Lend
entry.summary: A new lending platform spun up by protocol engineers at MakerDAO is looking to get the decentralized stablecoin DAI into more hands.

entry.title: Polygon Labs President Ryan Wyatt: 'The Next Jeff Bezos Will Come From Web3'
entry.summary: The former YouTube Gaming head joins Decrypt’s gm podcast to reflect on his path into crypto and how it can all go mainstream.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin and Ethereum Recover Modestly as Polygon, Filecoin, OKB See Blistering Gains
entry.summary: Crypto also caused a lot of consternation among regulators in Washington this week.

entry.title: Trader Makes $100K in Seconds Front-Running Token Listing on Binance
entry.summary: A trader whose wallet had already been associated with front-running token listings on Binance made over $100,000 in profit on Friday.

entry.title: A Stable Con: Key Takeaways From the SEC’s Lawsuit Against Terra
entry.summary: The SEC has filed fraud charges against Terra and its founder Do Kwon. Here are some of the more damning claims.

entry.title: gm: Ryan Wyatt on Polygon’s Winning Streak
entry.summary: Polygon Labs President Ryan Wyatt, the former YouTube Gaming head, helped turn Polygon into one of the crypto industry’s rare winners in 2022. In a lively chat with Dan Roberts and Andrew Hayward, he revealed why the promise of digital ownership pushed him from the gaming world into crypto, and how Polygon has pulled giants like Starbucks, Reddit, and Instagram into Web3. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: NFT Paris Founder Alexandre Tsydenkov Previews 2023 Event
entry.summary: NFTs take over Paris on February 23. Decrypt's Stephen Graves interviews NFT Paris founder Alexandre Tsydenkov about this year's conference, which features speakers from many of the top collections and companies in the space, plus lots of side events. Decrypt will be on hand as a media partner, conducting interviews and moderating panels. See you in France!

entry.title: 'Words with Friends' Creator Paul Bettner: Web3 Can Solve Twitch's Limitations
entry.summary: Paul Bettner tells Decrypt about the challenges he faced while developing his Web3 game "Wildcard."

entry.title: 'Words with Friends' Creator Paul Bettner on Why He's Building His Next Game 'Wildcard' in Web3
entry.summary: Paul Bettner shares his perspective on Web3 gaming platforms and his vision to make games everywhere and anywhere players want them.

entry.title: gm Week in Review: SEC Targets Staking, a16z Doesn’t Get Its Way, NFTs Popping
entry.summary: In our February 11, 2023 week in review episode, Matthew Diemer, Stacy Elliott, and Stephen Graves talk about the latest developments in the FTX case, 3AC founders trying for a comeback, a16z losing on a big Uniswap vote despite holding 15 million UNI tokens, and NFTs roaring back with CryptoPunks, Bored Apes, and Ordinals NFTs selling hot. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Bill Murray Discusses NFT Project, First Members-Only Event
entry.summary: Comedic legend Bill Murray sits down with Decrypt at his first exclusive party for NFT holders in Oceanside, California. He describes the project’s origins and why it didn’t feel “mercenary” for him to create an NFT-based membership club.

entry.title: gm: Kristin Smith and the Crypto Crusade in Washington
entry.summary: Kristin Smith is Executive Director of the Blockchain Association, which advocates for crypto policy in Washington D.C.—an exhausting effort that Sam Bankman-Fried was closely involved in, until he set it all on fire. Kristin tells Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott how SBF and FTX set things back, but there are still positive signs from crypto friendly voices in Congress. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: gm: Week in Review: Tech Layoffs, Porsche NFTs, Ted Cruz
entry.summary: In our January 28, 2023 week in review episode, Dan Roberts, Matthew Diemer, and Kate Irwin talk about more layoffs in crypto and broader tech (including how Google botched its layoffs), the NFT market rebound and Porsche’s NFT drop (fail or surprise success?), Sam Bankman-Fried’s latest claims about FTX US and the surprising list of big companies on the FTX creditor list, and Ted Cruz’s weird effort to get DC vendors to accept Bitcoin. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: How Web3 Is Disrupting Video Streaming: Myco, Theta Labs, and Actor David Bianchi
entry.summary: At an investor event in L.A. hosted by watch-to-earn video streaming platform Myco, Decrypt's Sander Lutz moderated a discussion about Film3 with Myco CCO Phil McKenzie, Theta Labs BD Head Andrea Berry, and actor and filmmaker David Bianchi, whose Web3 series "RZR" got funding through NFT drops.

entry.title: How Web3 and NFTs Are Disrupting Film: Myco, Livepeer, Ava Labs, Bad Grrls Creative Club
entry.summary: At an investor event in New York hosted by the watch-to-earn video streaming platform Myco, Decrypt's Dan Roberts moderated a lively chat about Film3 with Phil McKenzie from Myco, Toni Thai Sterrett the founder of NFT member collective Bad Grrls Creative Club, Doug Petkanics the founder of decentralized video hosting platform Livepeer, and Daniel Killeen of Avalanche blockchain developer Ava Labs.

entry.title: 'Iron Man' Comic Artist Sean Chen on Marvel vs. Web3
entry.summary: Marvel and DC Comics alum Sean Chen argues that while studios have made billions, comic artists aren't seeing even a fraction of that wealth.

entry.title: Marvel Artist Sean Chen on How Artificial Intelligence Will Shape Comics
entry.summary: "Eventually there's still a human brain that needs to be involved," Chen said of AI being used to create comics.

entry.title: Actor David Bianchi Previews His Web3 TV Series 'RZR'
entry.summary: Veteran actor David Bianchi spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson right before a public table read for Bianchi's upcoming drama series "RZR," to be distributed through Gala Films. The show is already greenlit and will be set in a dystopian future Los Angeles, with Ethereum and other digital assets as part of the plot. Bianchi also conducted two NFT drops to build engagement from fans.
